16.heading: Brothers-in-Law.
16.title: "Dangerous Vacation"
16.author: [No author]
16.series: Kent Blake) 7 p. in Kent Blake of the Secret Service, no. 5
notes: Summary: Kent Blake goes to Long Island for a vacation, and finds himself next door to Jason Grant, suspected of giving information about jets and guided missiles to the Reds. It turns out Jason is being hypnotized by a brother-in-law who sells the secrets to the Red Chinese, waiting offshore in a submarine (with a large red star insignia on its bow).

83.title: "Brouillons et Crayonnés : Portfolio : Leçons de Méthode à Travers les Collections du Musée" p. 70-83 in 9e Art : les Cahiers du Musée de la Bande Dessinée, no. 7
83.author: [No author]

contents.title: "Dut par Manuel Hirtz et Harry Morgan"

notes: English summary (from p. 151): "Rough Sketches and Crayon Drawings: Lessons in Method. '9e Art' has taken six pencilled drawings from the museum collections. These are by Pinchon, Hergé, Dut, Tardi, Kurtzman and Baudoin. Using these previously unpublished documents in which the act of creation can be seized in its very intimacy, the editorial staff investigates the purpose of rough sketches in the genesis of a comic and underlines the diversity of practises."

116.heading: Brousseau, Dave.
116.title: "Celebrity Restaurants"
116.author: by Dave Brousseau.
notes: Summary: Comments on Roseanne's diner, Bruce Willis, Demi Moore, Sylvester Stallone and Planet Hollywood, supermodels, athletes, and Madonna.
Undated strip; date given is that of publication in Between the Lines.

117.heading: Brousseau, Dave.
117.title: "I Can't Believe Delivering Pizzas is So Stressful"
117.author: by Dave Brousseau
117.appears_in: p. 38 in Between the Lines, no. 82 (Aug. 20-Sept. 2, 1998)
notes: Summary: The pizza man is met by the guys at the door, half-dressed and full of double-entendres about sausage and meat.

118.heading: Brousseau, Dave.
118.title: "It's a Dog Eat Dog World"
118.author: [No author]
118.series: A Couple of Guys, June 17, 1999) by Dave Brousseau.
notes: Final thought balloon of Matisse, the dog: "Whoever said environment doesn't affect sexual orientation wasn't a hairdresser's dog."

119.heading: Brousseau, Dave.
119.title: "Must You Always Be So Dramatic Around Halloween?"
119.author: by Dave Brousseau.
notes: Summary: Flushing while he's in the shower brings a reaction.

120.heading: Brousseau, Dave.
120.title: "She's Not Blonde Everywhere"
120.author: by Dave Brousseau.
notes: Summary: Making breakfast, and a strange dream about making love to that blonde bimbo from the dating show, and the question of a repressed desire.
Undated strip; date is that of publication in Between the Lines.
